Install VirtualBox in Windows | Step to Virtualization

VirtualBox is a powerful opensource virtualization software or platform that provides you to manage and run multiple operating systems as an application at the same time. This masterpiece was developed by Oracle Corporation for enterprise-level and home use. In 2007 the software was invented by Innotek GmbH and later acquired by Oracle in 2010. This application supports multiple guest operating systems such as Linux, Windows, Solaris, Mac OS, Unices and others.

Table of Content

  • Installation
    • Step 1: Download VirtualBox
    • Step 2: Install VirtualBox
    • Step 3: Setup Extension in VirtualBox (Optional)

Installation

Step 1: Download VirtualBox

  • Visit Oracle VirtualBox website https://www.virtualbox.org/ and go to the download as show in the picture below.

  • Now select the Windows hosts platform.

  • Save the Downlaod file.

  • Now download the extension pack. This helps you to connect your virtual machine with USB 2.0 and USB 3.0.

Note: Extension is not required to run VirtualBox. **This is optional**

Step 2: Install VirtualBox

  • Open and run the package from your Download directory.

  • You will see an installation window of VirtualBox. Click Next.

  • Go to Browse if you want to install in different location or Next for defalut.

  • Select the features for your desktop and Install.

  • Click Finish after the installation is completed.

Step 3: Setup Extension in VirtualBox (Optional)

  • Run the application. Go to Files -> Preferences -> Extensions and Add the extension from your Download Folder.

  • Select the extension

  • Agree on the policy and complete the setup. Now you will be able to see similar as shown below

Congratulation!!

Your installation is completed. Feel free to write me if you face any probelm.

07 Aug 2019
